verses.text: The descendants of Judah: Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.
verses.comment: Names given match earlier genealogies.

verses.text: Reaiah son of Shobal fathered Jahath, and Jahath fathered Ahumai and Lahad. These are the clans of the Zorathites.
verses.comment: Zorathites linked to the town Zorah in Judah.

verses.text: These are the sons of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash; and their sister was Hazzelelponi.
verses.comment: Hazzelelponi is a rare female name in this genealogy.

verses.text: Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer the father of Hushah. These are the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah, the father of Bethlehem.
verses.comment: Ephrathah is an alternate name for Bethlehem.

verses.text: Ashhur, the father of Tekoa, had two wives: Helah and Naarah.
verses.comment: Tekoa later becomes famous as a town and for the prophet Amos.

verses.text: Naarah bore Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Haahashtari. These are the sons of Naarah.
verses.comment: Haahashtari's name possibly means 'the Hashtarite.'

verses.text: The sons of Helah: Zereth, Izhar, and Ethnan.
verses.comment: Only these three sons listed for Helah.

verses.text: Koz fathered Anub, Zobebah, and the clans of Aharhel son of Harum.
verses.comment: Aharhel's descendants form a recognized clan.

verses.text: Jabez was more honorable than his brothers. His mother named him Jabez, saying, 'Because I bore him in pain.'
verses.comment: Play on words: Jabez sounds like Hebrew for 'pain.'

verses.text: Jabez called upon the God of Israel, saying, 'Oh, that you would indeed bless me and enlarge my territory, and that your hand would be with me, and that you would keep me from harm so that it might not bring me pain!' And God granted him what he requested.
verses.comment: This unique prayer is often referenced for its model of faith.

verses.text: Chelub, brother of Shuhah, fathered Mehir, who fathered Eshton.
verses.comment: Chelub likely the same as Caleb elsewhere in Chronicles.

verses.text: Eshton fathered Bethrapha, Paseah, and Tehinnah the father of Irnahash. These are the men of Recah.
verses.comment: Irnahash may mean 'city of the serpent.'

verses.text: The sons of Kenaz: Othniel and Seraiah; and the sons of Othniel: Hathath.
verses.comment: Othniel became a judge of Israel.

verses.text: Meonothai fathered Ophrah; and Seraiah fathered Joab, the ancestor of Geharrashim, so-called because they were craftsmen.
verses.comment: Geharrashim means 'valley of craftsmen.'

verses.text: The sons of Caleb son of Jephunneh: Iru, Elah, and Naam; and the son of Elah: Kenaz.
verses.comment: Caleb, son of Jephunneh, was one of the faithful spies.

verses.text: The sons of Jehallelel: Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.
verses.comment: Names possibly related to localities in Judah.

verses.text: The sons of Ezrah: Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon; and Mered's wife bore Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah, the father of Eshtemoa.
verses.comment: Eshtemoa is a town in southern Judah.

verses.text: His Jewish wife bore Jered, the father of Gedor, Heber, the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel, the father of Zanoah. These are the sons of Bithiah, daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered took.
verses.comment: Reference to an Egyptian woman married into Judah.

verses.text: The sons of Hodiah's wife, the sister of Naham: Keilah the Garmite, and Eshtemoa the Maacathite.
verses.comment: Keilah and Eshtemoa also appear as towns.

verses.text: The sons of Shimon: Amnon, Rinnah, Ben-hanan, and Tilon. The sons of Ishi: Zoheth and Benzoheth.
The sons of Shelah son of Judah: Er the father of Lecah, Laadah the father of Mareshah, and the families of the linen workers at Beth-ashbea;
verses.comment: Shelah's descendants noted for a specific craft.

verses.text: Jokim, and the men of Cozeba, and Joash, and Saraph, who ruled in Moab and returned to Lehem. These records are ancient.
verses.comment: Moab indicates some Judahites lived outside traditional boundaries.

verses.text: These were the potters who lived in Netaim and Gederah. They lived there with the king for his work.
verses.comment: Potters in royal service and living in specialized towns.

verses.text: The sons of Simeon: Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, and Shaul.
verses.comment: Matches tribal list in Numbers.

verses.text: Shallum his son, Mibsam his son, Mishma his son.
The sons of Mishma: Hammuel his son, Zaccur his son, Shimei his son.
Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters; but his brothers did not have many children, so all their families did not multiply as much as the sons of Judah.
verses.comment: Simeon's tribe smaller in numbers than Judah.

verses.text: They lived at Beersheba, Moladah, Hazar-shual,
verses.comment: Beersheba was a southern Israelite city.

verses.text: Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,
Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,
verses.comment: Ziklag was later given to David.

verses.text: Beth-marcaboth, Hazar-susim, Beth-biri, and Shaaraim. These were their towns until King David’s reign.
verses.comment: Indicates town holdings changed after David.

verses.text: And their villages: Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Tochen, and Ashan—five towns,
and all their villages that were around these towns, as far as Baal. These were their settlements, and they kept genealogical records.
verses.comment: Genealogy as a means to establish rights and inheritance.

verses.text: Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah son of Amaziah,
Joel, Jehu son of Joshibiah, son of Seraiah, son of Asiel,
Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,
Ziza son of Shiphi, son of Allon, son of Jedaiah, son of Shimri, son of Shemaiah—
these mentioned by name were leaders in their families, and their ancestral houses greatly increased.
verses.comment: Shows prominence among the tribe of Simeon.

verses.text: They went to the entrance of Gedor, to the east side of the valley, to seek pasture for their flocks.
verses.comment: Movement for seeking land and pasture.

verses.text: They found rich, good pasture; and the land was broad, quiet, and peaceful, for the former inhabitants were Hamites.
verses.comment: Hamites refers to descendants of Ham, possibly non-Israelite Canaanites.

verses.text: These whose names are recorded came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah and attacked their tents and the Meunites who were found there, and they destroyed them completely to this day, and settled in their place, because there was pasture for their flocks.
verses.comment: The Meunites are possibly an Edomite group.

verses.text: And some of them, five hundred men of the sons of Simeon, went to Mount Seir, with Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi, leading them.
verses.comment: Mount Seir is Edomite territory.

verses.text: They struck down the surviving Amalekites who had escaped, and they have lived there to this day.
verses.comment: Shows the ongoing conflict with Amalekites.
